meanings.definition: The act of serving as an officer.
meanings.sent1: Her officering in the military was a source of pride for her family.
meanings.sent2: The officering of the new recruits was a challenging but rewarding task for the experienced officer.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's officering of the fish in the aquarium was quite impressive.
meanings.sent4: The officering of responsibilities in the team fell on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: His officering during the crisis showed true leadership skills.

meanings.definition: The occupation or position of being an officer.
meanings.sent1: She aspired to attain a high-ranking officering in the police force.
meanings.sent2: The officering in the army comes with great responsibility and honor.
meanings.sent3: The cat's officering of the household involved keeping the mice in check.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, her officering as a CEO was highly respected.
meanings.sent5: The officering in the royal court was a position of power and influence.
